title: Unsupervised CP-UNet Framework for Denoising DAS Data with Decay Noise
author: Tianye Huang (China University of Geosciences), Aopeng Li (China University of Geosciences), Xiang Li (China University of Geosciences), Jing Zhang (China University of Geosciences), Sijing Xian (Liuzhou Wuling New Energy Automobile), Qi Zhang (China University of Geosciences), Xiangyun Hu (China University of Geosciences), Guodong Chen (China Electric Power Planning & Engineering Institute)
relevance_why: The proposed unsupervised learning method could inspire similar approaches in audio signal denoising, particularly considering how it leverages deep learning architectures like UNet, which has parallels in audio processing tasks.
background: The task focuses on improving the signal-to-noise ratio in distributed acoustic sensing (DAS) data, which is often contaminated by various types of noise.
contribution: This paper introduces the CP-UNet, an unsupervised learning model, to solve the challenge of denoising DAS data affected by noise, achieving superior noise reduction performance compared to traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods rely heavily on supervised learning requiring labeled data, while conventional denoising techniques fall short with complex noise types.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes an unsupervised approach that incorporates a Context Pyramid Module and a Connectivity Module for enhanced noise reduction, without the need for extensive labeled datasets.

key_innovation: The integration of a Context Pyramid Module facilitates feature extraction across various scales within the network architecture, improving the overall noise filtering process.
real_world_impact: This approach has the potential to improve the reliability and clarity of seismic data interpretations, which is crucial in fields such as geosciences and civil engineering.

new_terms.Context-Pyramid-UNet: **Context-Pyramid-UNet (CP-UNet)** is a deep learning architecture that combines features of UNet with a Context Pyramid Module to effectively denoise and reconstruct signals from noisy datasets.
